reviewText:
since the game is not worth to talk about, here is one of my favorite recipe; Crispy Coconut Chicken.

Ingredients; 2 egg whites
3 cups whole grain cereal (corn flakes or brown rice cereal recommended)
1/4 cup shredded sweetened coconut
1 pound(0.5ish kg) boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into strips
Nonstick cooking spray

Preheat oven to 400-degrees F( 200 celsius). Coat a baking sheet with nonstick spray and set aside. Place egg whites in a bowl and beat until frothy. Place cereal and coconut in a resealable plastic bag; season with salt and pepper and crush well. Dredge chicken strips in egg white and place a couple at a time into the bag to coat with coconut mixture. Transfer to baking sheet. Bake for 6 to 7 minutes per side, until chicken is cooked through.

If you have the time and money for it, put the chicken strips in coconut milk for the night before.
http://imgur.com/5AEfhza

reviewText:
This isn't even pay to win, it's more like free to log in, pay to play. Basically everything in the game has to be bought with real money - units, resources, everything. You do get some resources and units for free, but so slowly that you won't be able to play more than a few minutes each day unless you're willing to pay.

The game is designed completely about making you spend money. It's balanced so you can't avoid heavy loses and have to pay for units if you want to continue playing. Creatures' fighitng strength depends on your level as well, so there are no easy fights and you actually become weaker as you level up. The same fight that you won with 65 archers and 65 sentinels with moderate losses will be lost or result in heavy losses with 180 archers and 90 sentinels.

Same with buildings. The upgrades are so expensive and provide so little that you won't ever want to build them except for a quest.

Can't recommend. Try HOMM3 instead.

reviewText:
I managed to play 2 hours of this Ubisoft masterpiece!
That is more than most reviewers so far. It was a complete waste of time.
Microtransactions up your wazoo.
It takes 55 minutes of real time to recruit archers, 4 minutes to build a town hall etc. Nothing interesting to explore or discover. No strategy except waste time or spend real world money. Fun: 0/10
The actual combat system could have been fun if the devs had bothered to make a real game instead a money leech to prey on suckers and kiddies.
This game belongs on tablets or phones, not STEAM. It is an insult to the memory of HOMM.
(For the true heroes experience, buy heroes 3 complete CD and play it on a windows XP computer instead.)
The user agreement contains abusive clauses such as Ubisoft giving itself the right to request a copy of your passport or national ID card!  You should read it!

reviewText:
I have only run this game on steam so that it would let me comment. I've accumulated a few tens of hours on it on the whatever it was platform that it used to be on. Ubisoftisomethingorother. Anyway, here's what you need to know about this game:

It CAN be a fun time waster. Run around with your army, pit them against things, cast some spells and make the people fall down and all that. The combat mechanics are unabashedly lifted from previous might and magic heroes games and I don't have a problem with that. That makes sense. That works more or less fine.

It's pretty much everything else that becomes or creates problems. Problems that they would prefer you throw real world money at to resolve. There are some very long wait timers for reinforcements in this game. On the order of days to replenish a completely decimated section of troops. Advanced troop options also cost special resources per troop, which you can only obtain a trickle of without shelling out the cash. To pervert a famous saying: all roads lead to your wallet.

Now, I didn't just give up on the game immediately when I saw these problems, I went ahead and did what I could to get as far as I could stomach into the game. Which was near level 20. 17 I think? It's been a while since I gave up on this game. But if you want to maximize what you can do in it without shelling out the money, I would suggest playing a cleric. Get healing as soon as possible. Abuse healing. Healing spells in this game will resurrect dead troops. This is how I wound up with a sizable stockpile of basic troops, as I eventually reached a critical mass in my healing capabilities to keep from losing significant numbers of troops each day that I played. But this strategy does not work forever. As mentioned earlier, advanced troops cost special resources, and the only way to get those without handing over real world money is to do little daily quests that give you just a handful of, say, crystal each day. I'm not sure what the total amount might be at the end game, but where I was it was about 6 of this crystal attached to an annoying daily quest. 6 per day is not enough. Even with resurrections and very careful healing, you're going to lose more than 6 troops of any given kind in any given day. Further, at that slow rate, it's going to take you weeks to accumulate an entire troop of any given advanced soldier. I had a unit stack maximum of something like 120 or 135 or so. Trying to fill that on 6 per day seems like too much a fool's errand, too much an investment of time and efforts, to bother with for what payoff the game provides.

The chat is not particularly good either, and it seemed very cumbersome to try and group up with any strangers as you might do in any other multiplayer game out there. So cumbersome, in fact, that I don't think I was ever actually in any combats with a player run team mate.

If you want to play it, go in expecting it to try and get at your wallet and steel yourself against the obvious tactics employed to do so. It can be fun for fooling around in, but I wouldn't make the mistake of taking the game seriously or investing in it.

Edit: To be perfectly clear- when I meant that it Can be a fun time waster, I meant for a few hours or so at best each day. And only if you already like the combat style of previous heroes of might and magic games. I've noticed in other reviews that people mention the awful build timers, and I will confirm that those take in the area of day(s) to resolve and they only get longer as you progress. Furthermore, they require basic resources like wood and gold. This wouldn't be much of a problem, but the only passive means of gaining either is a very drop in the bucket trickle. Which necessitates grinding for both, through combat, to build the buildings that you need to get the troop reinforcements that you need to do the combat that you need to get the resources that you need to build the buildings that you need to....you get the idea. At low level I could see it being a very vicious cycle if you didn't immediately pick up healing and abuse the hell out of it constantly.

reviewText:
I decided to give this game a try, despite the negative comments about it... Unfortunately, I agree with every single negative one. They expect you to be made of money and shovel every dime that you have to win at this. I was hoping for a traditional type Roleplay Game and was slapped with a strategy based thing that wasn't even worthy of the title. The game did NOT let me move my soldiers like I wanted to, and would want to put them in harms way when they did. Which took away from the strategy portion of the game. This is the first time in a LONG time I've been completely and utterly disappointed in a game...

Seriously guys. Unless you value your sanity, DO NOT play this game.
Game Devs... Really? You really had to botch up what could have been a wonderful game? I've seen monkeys do better.

reviewText:
The game is not the worst that I have played in the series. Here's looking at you HoMM7.

But I've been getting constant connectivity issues with this game and this game alone. More often than not it freezes up during loading sequences, mostly when heading into battle and after a battle. Then when it feels like it, it freezes up when I'm trying to boot up the game. Background music is playing, but the screen is just not moving to the next phase..

Irritating to say the least when certain items or buffs have real-life time limits that continue to countdown when you're trying to get into the game.

It's not player friendly, it tries to frustrate you every chance it gets and puts a pay wall there to take the frustration away.
An example would be inventory. 15 inventory slots simply isn't enough. I refuse to pay for this.

I found a better way to take the frustration away.

Uninstalled.

reviewText:
I am trying to like it, really am. But i am not enjoying it the way i want to... I loved the old series, i have very fond childhood memories to the old series. This version is so dissapointing and frustrating. It is more a tablet or smartphone game than a PC game. PC gamers go on their pc's to play a videogame for a couple of hours, but you cant with this silly game. After about 10 minutes you're pretty much done again. Playing the waiting game... You're restricted in so many ways, new troops take hours and hours to regenerate unless you pay them money to hasten it. New resources take ages to regenerate unless you pay them money. More hero slots = more money. Money. Money. Money!

I'd GLADLY pay 10-15 euro for this game if it was without the micro transactions and faster army regenerations etc. The way it is right now though is simply unplayable and certainly not worth spending ANY money on.

None of this is about enjoyment, its pay to win.
I don't understand why this is even on Steam, this is something that you'd expect in the Play Store on your mobile device. Under the free apps section, where it belongs.

reviewText:
Please don't be alarmed about the negative reviews.
My first impression of the game from just the negative reviews were that this game sucked before even playing it, but a friend talked me into playing it and I got hooked.

I am writing this after 25 hours of playing the game since the launch on Steam so I think I have some right to do this review

tl;dr The game is okay, it's not the best but it is playable without doing any micro transactions or anything.

In this review I'm not quoting any other review people have given just typing the most generic review of which i have seen.

Let's talk about Steam Launch/micro transactions and the bad reviews.
I have been looking at pretty much all of the negative reviews and some of them are pretty good and gives fair points.
But some of them are just people that had problem with the steam launch or are just Steam Hardcore people.

First day of launch. A lot of people that started to play could not get in because of couldn't load plugins and just gave up right there and wrote a bad review. Not really fair if you ask me, It would be like I would just give up on a game such as Diablo 3 on launch for error 37, that was a REAL problem but that was fixed. And so was this after the first day.
When entering battle with a friend the game sometimes would get locked and you couldn't do anything because everything wasn’t loaded properly, to fix you had to restart the game, and when you got back you were still in the combat so you didn't have to restart or give up on your friend, this have been solved from what I have seen.
There were some clipping problem but it really wasn’t an issue at all

Micro Transaction in the game pretty okay for the resources that you get, As of yet I haven't payed anything but i have gone through the shop looking at all the different things you can buy. You can get SEALS" which is the pay currency from the main quest and different daily quests later in the game so you can still get them through that and if you log in everyday you will also get them from being an active player. If anything you can play this game for free no problem at all it just takes more time to play and some grinding.
If you compare it to any else game it's pretty much the same as Hearthstone
date: Magic the Gathering and league of legends. If you pay things
recommended: you will get the easier and faster. But people that don't have the time or money will say immediately "p2w" when you still can complete the game without paying anything.\n\nThe most generic negative review for the game. "Mobile game inside a web browser with micro transaction p2w" As of yet I haven't payed a dime
hoursPlayed: cent or Pennie for the game and it have been going pretty good.\nI haven't had any problem progressing in the game without paying for faster unit or anything
voteText: you just need to be patient in the game to get in to it. Just going down a lot of the negative reviews they are MOSTLY people that have played 0.5 or less saying "p2w wait forever" etc.\nAfter 25 hours I am level 13 and got 50 upgraded Sentinels and around 250 archers and 120 battle priests and is still going strong without paying anything
helpfulPercent:
I have been grinding wood but nothing else really and will lose around 1-0 units per fight while farming. It's not hard at all.


Please comment if you want me to add something to the review like about the interface
votesHelpful: gameplay etc.\nThis is my first real review that i have written for a game without joking around."

reviewText:
Yes & No.

First and foremost i voted Yes because i am a Heroes Might & Magic fans. The game play and co-op system is great.

However, the game / server itself is full of bugs. As example:

(A) During co-op battle, our action bar and skill list at the bottom will go missing, the only way to solve this is to shut down the whole game and restart it and we have to pray hard that our turn is not missed thanks to such stupid bug as every turn is very crucial especially after you are a Dragon Knight (played like half a year and complained alot but still no improvement).

recommended: else all the channels will be not accessible.\n\nOverall its a good go if you are Heroes Might & Magic fans."

reviewText: I'm now 25 hours into this game and I will say it has high production value. The graphics and sound fx are stunningly good for a HOMM game. The battles are tighter and each creature type plays a visibly specific role, and you can team up with other players and have all your troops on the field at once.\n\nUnsurprisingly, some of the funner perks in the game come at a real money price. I've spend $14 and found that it expanded the confines of the game in a pleasant way. Worth it? Only if you're really into the game itself and plan on playing it for awhile. Otherwise, not necessary.

reviewText:
i liked it... the strating quests that are so important and very good if you want to know the lore? yeah i don't like em... just give me everything the starting quests give me and a main quest that tells me to kill some mobs... thats how i want my tutorial but otherwise pretty good. didn't experience any issues in the 2 hours i plaid... the world seems a bit cramped because of the strict path you have to follow. it would be more immersive if the paths would connect every so often as in the normal heroes of might and magic maps. i am not sure why everyone keeps complaining this game is bad but hey... i only plaid for 2 hours because i got bored of the generic rpg... over all. 4/10 try it if you like generic rpgs with the twist of HOM&M fighting mechanic (wich have been seen)
pros:
*The starting quests give you a good idea of how to do everything but you could survive without them because of the clarity of things.
*The art style sticks to the original theme/style of HOM&M wich i think is good.
*Re-tought enemies and minions but sticks to the original plan of them.
*Well balanced fights and the system that detects the hardness level doesn't lie.
cons:
*The game seemed like just another rpg copy wich it doesen't claim not to be.
*For me the map seemed a bit cramped. (atleast for the undead didn't play any other race)

reviewText:
First of all, I played this a lot before it popped up in steam and played it more or less active 9 months.

Ignore those comments where it says that this is pay to win - its not. Only start is hard when not having lot of troops but it time is on your side, you can always come back next day and fight again. Game currency is one of the most generous I`ve seen in mmorpg`s. If planning to invest you can get quite a lot with only 10 euros or so.

I recommend this game because as it is, its one of the best browser mmorpg there is. However, there isnt any end game atm for old gamers and thats been problem really long. Devs not updating game almost at all and effort they put this game is really minimum if not even less.

There is PVP but its a joke.

Give it a shot, you will be busy good 6months for sure before reaching end game and all tiers for weapons.

Slow update is good thing for new players - you can catch up older ones.

7/10 - would be higher if devs could give some love for this game.

reviewText: It is a free to play version of might and magic. I like a lot the new backstab and flanking mechanics the game brings, this coupled with a smaller battlefield with more obstacles that allow for chokepoints make this game have a compelling strategy to play around. In this version I acually feel that there is a much bigger impact that comes from strategy in battles than mere amount of units to obtain raw power. I definitely recommend this game, though it is not for the impatient as it does take a lot of time to replenish your army.

reviewText:
Heroes of M&M online is a browser based MMO with microtransaction pay system . As someone who played every game in the series over 15 years I very much enjoyed this game despite that I am not a fan of micro payments.

Microtrasactions are bad! Browser game on steam is bad ! - Every negative review . I do agree with those obvious points and if you do not want to play based on that it is your choice. However if you want to know opinion of someone who actually played this game all the way then you can read the rest .

First of all it is a browser game . That means you need Flash Player,Enabled hardware Acceleration and working internet to play it . You could use steam to create account but I recommend going to offical website to avoid complications . http://clb.heroes-online.com/en-US/home . Steam and Browser accounts are not compitable so I would go with the website instead just because it has been up longer .

As far as the gameplay goes it is similar to other games but instead of playing agaist another city you will progress through text based narrative story over 4 chapters. Micropayments will be tied to hinger your progression like building timers,inventory space limits and rare resources .You will run out of army eventually and will be forced to wait for units to recharge . However you can avoid much of that by playing in coop which makes battles easier . Ask people for help and advice when in doubt if you can win a battle. I played this game over 150 hours and spend no money on boosts .


Pros:
2 Player coop. Teamwork can lessen difficulty .
4 Chapters+post game . Not counting timers and grinding , it is a 30-40 hours game .
Combat is enjoyable .
Artifact and skill system promotes different styles of play. Decent loot system with so many different artifacts that people don't even know all of them .
Many challanging boss fights unlike regular MM games that had only armies vs armies .

Cons:

Microtranactions are all over the place. You don't have to use them if you play smart . It may take some time before you actually undestand how to do it .
Many reused models from heroes 5,6 .
Slow movement speed without boosts .
Players who are not familiar with the series will have much harder time starting .

I would give this game 6.5/10 If you gona play a game with mobile economy you might as well play one with lots of content and decent combat system .

This game has very poor steam review and its not justfied considering its one of the better microtransaction games because of content volume. If you can't make a proper negative review you only reviewing your lack of good opinion .

Note : Feel free to contact me if you have questions or need help with battles . My character is maxed out so you won't actually loose a single unit . I don't have time to beat entire game for you but if you stack on a boss and have no units let me know .
voteText: 19 of 43 people (44%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I do not see why the game receives such negative feedback. It is what it is: a money grabbing time sink. I would not hate the game for being what it is, but shake my head why we see such game on Steam. This is a browser game, it should have no place on this platform.

But to say something about the game itself:
+ The graphics are good
+ I really like the flanking/backstabbing mechanic
- It is a money grabbing time sink not worthy for Steam

So if you have all the time in the world or the money you could possibly enjoy the game. Otherwise it is nothing for you.

reviewText:
Graphic is ok. Played the game with steam link on a living room tv and it looks ok too when sitting at a distance. There is a resolution size issues on the tv so I cannot see where the icons are, so shortcut all of the buttons to the controller to make it easier to access.

After a learning curve, i am starting to like the game.

Unlike HOMM5, there is no deployment stage, and so I did suffered a huge lost. Now that I have some useful abilities, the combat is more under control instead of just full on clash.

The waiting time is long, so do not expect to play the game for a long period of time. I usually have to stop after an hour. I think after a couple more upgrade I should have an abundant amount of soldiers to play for another hour.

There is a steam guild on how to get soldiers quickly.

reviewText:
Saw a lot of complaints. I playedfor about 3 hours so far and found nothing more than expected from a free game.
This is a mix of any other online city building game and the good old Heroes style turn based fighting.

I would agreewith some that the time to gain new troops is a bit long. So if your looking for a game to play every once in a while. Which is perfect for me with work and family. This is the game for you :)

I would recomend this game just remember your playing a free game from a company that does hope to amek money some how.

Have fun gaming!

reviewText:
-- This review is for MacOS/Linux --
Disclaimer: I'm e techie and I love the HoMM series. Tests done on 3 machines and 3 accounts.
* Mac: Installed Chrome, Flash is installed. The game won't start from Steam.
* Linux: Installed Chrome, Flash is installed. Game starts from Steam, Can create character, freezes at pressing [START].
* Windows: No, not that desperate yet... :)
CONCLUSION: Another poorly delivered micro-transaction money grab from UBI Soft.

reviewText:
Linux user here.

Played this on Chrome, the Flash version. Worked perfectly, for nostalgia hits, I try it from time to time.

This particular version ... I get a white screen while trying to play. Checking the local content reveals a bad file, downloading it, gives a 0 byte sized file that does nothing. Downloading the whole game again also changes nothing. Not bothering with support, it just directed me to player forums and the above was their solution.

For anyone interested. It's an OK game, the battlefield fights are nice, but unless you pay, you'll waste a lot of time each day before starting collecting troops from various castles (not a problem early on, really really bothersome later).
And PvP ... don't bother unless you're willing to pay a lot. Because you can have multiple characters and transfer troops from one char to another. Making low level fights frustrating when you go against a bunch of archangels.

tl;dr. Linux version seriously bugged. Pay-to-win, but decent FB game otherwise.
